verses.kjv: And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,
verses.web: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness
verses.ct: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan River and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Being forty days tempted of the devil. And in those days he did eat nothing: and when they were ended, he afterward hungered.
verses.web: for forty days, being tempted by the devil. He ate nothing in those days. Afterward, when they were completed, he was hungry.
verses.ct: For 40 days the devil tempted him there. He ate nothing during that entire time, and when it was over, he was starving.

verses.kjv: And the devil said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, command this stone that it be made bread.
verses.web: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become bread.”
verses.ct: The devil said to him, "If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to turn into bread."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered him, saying, It is written, That man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.
verses.web: Jesus answered him, saying, “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.’ ”
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "It is written: 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God.'"

verses.kjv: And the devil, taking him up into an high mountain, shewed unto him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.web: The devil, leading him up on a high mountain, showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
verses.ct: Then the devil led him up to a high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a single instant.

verses.kjv: And the devil said unto him, All this power will I give thee, and the glory of them: for that is delivered unto me; and to whomsoever I will I give it.
verses.web: The devil said to him, “I will give you all this authority, and their glory, for it has been delivered to me; and I give it to whomever I want.
verses.ct: The devil told him, "I will give you all this authority and all their glory, because it has been handed over to me, and I can give it to anyone I choose.

verses.kjv: If thou therefore wilt worship me, all shall be thine.
verses.web: If you therefore will worship before me, it will all be yours.”
verses.ct: So if you worship me, it will all be yours."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto him, Get thee behind me, Satan: for it is written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and him only shalt thou serve.
verses.web: Jesus answered him, “Get behind me Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’ ”
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "Get behind me, Satan! For it is written: 'You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.'"

verses.kjv: And he brought him to Jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacle of the temple, and said unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thyself down from hence:
verses.web: He led him to Jerusalem, and set him on the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, cast yourself down from here,
verses.ct: Then the devil brought him to Jerusalem and placed him on the highest point of the temple. He said, "If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here.

verses.kjv: For it is written, He shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee:
verses.web: for it is written, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you, to guard you;’
verses.ct: For it is written: 'He will command his angels to watch over you and keep you safe,'

verses.kjv: And in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone.
verses.web: and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, lest perhaps you dash your foot against a stone.’ ”
verses.ct: and, 'They will lift you up in their hands so that you won't even strike your foot against a stone.'"

verses.kjv: And Jesus answering said unto him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God.
verses.web: Jesus answering, said to him, “It has been said, ‘You shall not tempt the Lord your God.’ ”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "It is said: 'You shall not tempt the Lord your God.'"

verses.kjv: And when the devil had ended all the temptation, he departed from him for a season.
verses.web: When the devil had completed every temptation, he departed from him until another time.
verses.ct: When the devil had finished every temptation, he left Jesus alone — but only until the next opportunity.

verses.kjv: And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee: and there went out a fame of him through all the region round about.
verses.web: Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit into Galilee, and news about him spread through all the surrounding area.
verses.ct: Jesus returned to Galilee in the power of the Spirit, and news about him spread throughout the entire region.

verses.kjv: And he taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all.
verses.web: He taught in their synagogues, being glorified by all.
verses.ct: He taught in their synagogues, and everyone praised him.

verses.kjv: And he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as his custom was, he went into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up for to read.
verses.web: He came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up. He entered, as was his custom, into the synagogue on the Sabbath day, and stood up to read.
verses.ct: He traveled to Nazareth, the town where he'd grown up. On the Sabbath he went to the synagogue as he always did and stood up to read.

verses.kjv: And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias. And when he had opened the book, he found the place where it was written,
verses.web: The book of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. He opened the book, and found the place where it was written,
verses.ct: The scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to him. He unrolled it and found the passage that says:

verses.kjv: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he hath anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to preach deliverance to the captives, and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty them that are bruised,
verses.web: “The Spirit of the Lord is on me, because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the broken hearted, to proclaim release to the captives, recovering of sight to the blind, to deliver those who are crushed,
verses.ct: "The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to bring good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the brokenhearted, to announce freedom for the captives, sight for the blind, and to set free those who are crushed,

verses.kjv: To preach the acceptable year of the Lord.
verses.web: and to proclaim the acceptable year of the Lord.”
verses.ct: and to declare the year of the Lord's favor."

verses.kjv: And he closed the book, and he gave it again to the minister, and sat down. And the eyes of all them that were in the synagogue were fastened on him.
verses.web: He closed the book, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all in the synagogue were fastened on him.
verses.ct: He rolled up the scroll, handed it back to the attendant, and sat down. Every eye in the synagogue was fixed on him.

verses.kjv: And he began to say unto them, This day is this scripture fulfilled in your ears.
verses.web: He began to tell them, “Today, this Scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”
verses.ct: Then he said, "Today, this Scripture has been fulfilled right as you heard it."

verses.kjv: And all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said, Is not this Joseph’s son?
verses.web: All testified about him, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth, and they said, “Isn’t this Joseph’s son?”
verses.ct: Everyone spoke well of him and marveled at the gracious words that came from his mouth. But then they asked, "Wait — isn't this Joseph's son?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Ye will surely say unto me this proverb, Physician, heal thyself: whatsoever we have heard done in Capernaum, do also here in thy country.
verses.web: He said to them, “Doubtless you will tell me this parable, ‘Physician, heal yourself! Whatever we have heard done at Capernaum, do also here in your hometown.’ ”
verses.ct: He said to them, "No doubt you'll quote this proverb at me: 'Doctor, heal yourself!' You'll say, 'Do here in your hometown what we've heard you did in Capernaum.'"

verses.kjv: And he said, Verily I say unto you, No prophet is accepted in his own country.
verses.web: He said, “Most certainly I tell you, no prophet is acceptable in his hometown.
verses.ct: Then he added, "I tell you the truth — no prophet is accepted in his own hometown.

verses.kjv: But I tell you of a truth, many widows were in Israel in the days of Elias, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months, when great famine was throughout all the land;
verses.web: But truly I tell you, there were many widows in Israel in the days of Elijah, when the sky was shut up three years and six months, when a great famine came over all the land.
verses.ct: Believe me, there were many widows in Israel during the time of Elijah, when the sky was shut for 3 and a half years and a severe famine struck the whole land.

verses.kjv: But unto none of them was Elias sent, save unto Sarepta, a city of Sidon, unto a woman that was a widow.
verses.web: Elijah was sent to none of them, except to Zarephath, in the land of Sidon, to a woman who was a widow.
verses.ct: Yet Elijah wasn't sent to any of them. Instead, he was sent to a widow in Zarephath, in the region of Sidon.

verses.kjv: And many lepers were in Israel in the time of Eliseus the prophet; and none of them was cleansed, saving Naaman the Syrian.
verses.web: There were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, yet not one of them was cleansed, except Naaman, the Syrian.”
verses.ct: And there were many lepers in Israel during the time of the prophet Elisha, yet not one of them was healed — only Naaman, a Syrian."

verses.kjv: And all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were filled with wrath,
verses.web: They were all filled with wrath in the synagogue, as they heard these things.
verses.ct: When the people in the synagogue heard this, they were furious.

verses.kjv: And rose up, and thrust him out of the city, and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their city was built, that they might cast him down headlong.
verses.web: They rose up, threw him out of the city, and led him to the brow of the hill that their city was built on, that they might throw him off the cliff.
verses.ct: They jumped to their feet, forced him out of the city, and dragged him to the edge of the hill their town was built on, intending to throw him off the cliff.

verses.kjv: But he passing through the midst of them went his way,
verses.web: But he, passing through the middle of them, went his way.
verses.ct: But Jesus walked right through the middle of the crowd and went on his way.

verses.kjv: And came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbath days.
verses.web: He came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee. He was teaching them on the Sabbath day,
verses.ct: He went down to Capernaum, a city in Galilee, and taught the people on the Sabbath.

verses.kjv: And they were astonished at his doctrine: for his word was with power.
verses.web: and they were astonished at his teaching, for his word was with authority.
verses.ct: They were amazed at his teaching because his words carried real authority.

verses.kjv: And in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,
verses.web: In the synagogue there was a man who had a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
verses.ct: In the synagogue there was a man possessed by the spirit of an unclean demon, and he screamed at the top of his voice,

verses.kjv: Saying, Let us alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art; the Holy One of God.
verses.web: saying, “Ah! what have we to do with you, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are: the Holy One of God!”
verses.ct: "Leave us alone! What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are — the Holy One of God!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him. And when the devil had thrown him in the midst, he came out of him, and hurt him not.
verses.web: Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be silent, and come out of him!” When the demon had thrown him down in the middle of them, he came out of him, having done him no harm.
verses.ct: Jesus commanded him sharply, "Be silent and come out of him!" The demon threw the man down in front of everyone, then came out without hurting him.

verses.kjv: And they were all amazed, and spake among themselves, saying, What a word is this! for with authority and power he commandeth the unclean spirits, and they come out.
verses.web: Amazement came on all, and they spoke together, one with another, saying, “What is this word? For with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out!”
verses.ct: Everyone was stunned. They said to each other, "What kind of authority is this? He commands unclean spirits with power, and they obey him!"

verses.kjv: And the fame of him went out into every place of the country round about.
verses.web: News about him went out into every place of the surrounding region.
verses.ct: News about him spread to every corner of the surrounding region.

verses.kjv: And he arose out of the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. And Simon’s wife’s mother was taken with a great fever; and they besought him for her.
verses.web: He rose up from the synagogue, and entered into Simon’s house. Simon’s mother-in-law was afflicted with a great fever, and they begged him for her.
verses.ct: Jesus left the synagogue and went to Simon's house. Simon's mother-in-law was suffering from a severe fever, and they begged Jesus to help her.

verses.kjv: And he stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her: and immediately she arose and ministered unto them.
verses.web: He stood over her, and rebuked the fever; and it left her. Immediately she rose up and served them.
verses.ct: He stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. She got up immediately and began serving them.

verses.kjv: Now when the sun was setting, all they that had any sick with divers diseases brought them unto him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.
verses.web: When the sun was setting, all those who had any sick with various diseases brought them to him; and he laid his hands on every one of them, and healed them.
verses.ct: As the sun was going down, people brought everyone they knew who was sick with all kinds of diseases to Jesus. He placed his hands on each one of them and healed them.

verses.kjv: And devils also came out of many, crying out, and saying, Thou art Christ the Son of God. And he rebuking them suffered them not to speak: for they knew that he was Christ.
verses.web: Demons also came out of many, crying out, and saying, “You are the Christ, the Son of God!” Rebuking them, he didn’t allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Christ.
verses.ct: Demons also came out of many people, shouting, "You are Christ, the Son of God!" But he rebuked them and wouldn't let them speak, because they knew he was the Christ.

verses.kjv: And when it was day, he departed and went into a desert place: and the people sought him, and came unto him, and stayed him, that he should not depart from them.
verses.web: When it was day, he departed and went into an uninhabited place, and the multitudes looked for him, and came to him, and held on to him, so that he wouldn’t go away from them.
verses.ct: At daybreak, Jesus left and went to a remote place. The crowds searched for him, and when they found him, they tried to keep him from leaving.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, I must preach the kingdom of God to other cities also: for therefore am I sent.
verses.web: But he said to them, “I must preach the good news of God’s Kingdom to the other cities also. For this reason I have been sent.”
verses.ct: But he told them, "I have to preach the good news of God's Kingdom to other towns too. That's why I was sent."

verses.kjv: And he preached in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.web: He was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee.
verses.ct: So he continued preaching in the synagogues throughout Galilee.
